alert.note: Alert for Brewster; Pecos; Terrell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 23 at 9:15AM CDT until August 23 at 2:00PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHEASTERN BREWSTER, SOUTHEASTERN PECOS AND TERRELL COUNTIES... At 915 AM CDT, emergency management reported low water crossings along US 385 are flooded. Between 4 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sanderson, Dryden, Terrell County Gas Plant, Terrell County Airport and Sierra Madera. This includes the following streams and drainages... Big Fielder Draw, Maxon Creek, Cox Creek, Dry Creek, Independence Creek, Mitchell Draw, Thurston Canyon, Cedar Creek, Indian Creek, Meyers Canyon, North Fork Independence Creek, Fresno Creek, Cow Creek, Garcia Creek, Nineteen Draw, Sixshooter Draw, Prairie Creek, Buena Creek, Grande, Rio, Pyle Draw, Fourmile Draw, Magoy Creek, Tunas Creek, Sanderson Canyon, McKay Creek, Harral Draw, Pony Creek, Comanche Creek, Candilla Creek, Cook Creek, Big Canyon, San Francisco Creek, Pumpjack Creek, Persimmon Creek and Downie Draw. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
